education.institution: EPFL (Swiss Federal Institute of Technology of Lausanne)
EPFL (Swiss Federal Institute of Technology of Lausanne)

education.note: (Quit due to visa issues and COVID)

education.institution: University of Electronic Science and Technology of China

work.name: Didi Chuxing (China's largest taxi-hailing platform)
work.summary: Developed an algorithm for learning road segment weights from historical ride data, improving route planning quality for ride-hailing services.

work.name: Oracle Labs
work.summary: Developed and evaluated a machine learning model that detects anomalous Linux sessions in the cloud servers.

projects.name: Efficient Training Data Attribution for Large Language Models
projects.summary: Training Data Attribution faces severe computational challenges for modern-sized LLMs. We improved conventional influence functions by exploiting the low-rank property of the gradient to make them more efficient and scalable.

projects.name: Improving Waste Detection and Sorting on Conveyor Belt
projects.summary: Supervising two projects: (1) YOLO uncertainty estimation and confidence recalibration and (2) real‑time object brand recognition on conveyor belts.

projects.name: Learning to Weight Parameters for Training Data Attribution
projects.summary: Revealed the heterogeneity of attribution strengths across parameters; proposed a method that learns to re-weight layers to amplify the true signal, boosting accuracy and enabling fine-grained (e.g., subject vs. style) attribution.

projects.name: Enhancing Compositional Text-to-Image Generation with Reliable Random Seeds
projects.summary: Identified the significant role of initial noise in text-to-image inconsistencies; proposed a method to mine reliable random seeds to improve text-to-image generation.

projects.name: Controlling the Fidelity and Diversity of Deep Generative Models via Pseudo Density
projects.summary: Proposed an approach to bias deep generative models, such as GANs and diffusion models, towards generating data with either enhanced fidelity or increased diversity.
projects.note: TMLR 2024 (Selected for poster presentation at ICLR 2025)

projects.name: Interlock-Free Multi-Aspect Rationalization for Text Classification
projects.summary: Proposed a multi-stage training method incorporating an additional self-supervised contrastive loss that helps to alleviate the interlocking issue and extract more semantically diverse rationales.
